entry.value: Input table containing columns to be selected for visualization

Metanode for creating volcano plot (dependency of -log(p value) on log(fold change)) from selected columns of input table. It enables you to select limits on both axis to categorize all points based on significance/ratio value.%%00010%%00010Ratios/fold changes should be provided in log transformed format (logFC) together with the logFC limit for values categorization, visualization and summary.%%00010%%00010P values are by default transformed using negative decadic logarithm (-log10), but it can be switched off in case you provide already -log10 transformed values.%%00010In case the p values are not -log10 transformed and they contain zero values, metanode will end up with error because -log(0) is not possible. Provide some reasonably small number for imputation or use 0 to exclude these points from the graph.%%00010%%00010It is possible to label points of interest in the volcano plot. There are two types of labelling: manual and automatic. Automatic labelling is performed based on the p-values and logFC (or both), it is possible to automatically label all or a top N number of significantly changed points from one or both sides of the volcano plot. In case of manual labelling, names of points of interest need to correspond to names used in the selected annotation column. Automatic and manual labelling are not mutually excluded, they are performed atop of each other.%%00010%%00010=================%%00010%%00010Used programs and tools and their respective licenses at the time of the metanode creation. Version numbers and the licenses might differ based on your local installation. Please inspect your local installation and contact us if you can not locate your local version and or license terms.%%00010%%00010KNIME nodes (The KNIME nodes consists of the following GNU GPL 3.0 License. Licence terms are available here: https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html)%%00010Python 3.6 (The Python consists of the following Python 3 License. Licence terms are available here: https://docs.python.org/3/license.html)%%00010R 3.6 (R consists of the following GNU GPL 2.0 License. Licence terms are available here: https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html)%%00010%%00010The metanode was created in KNIME 4.1.3 running inside the docker image (https://hub.docker.com/r/cfprot/knime/), tag 4.1.3a.%%00010%%00010=================%%00010%%00010This version of metanode is available under the GNU GPL 3.0 License, unless stated otherwise. The full version of the license terms is available at https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.html.%%00010Version: 0.2.16 from 2023-02-22%%00010Contact person: Karolina Krystofova (karolina.krystofova@ceitec.muni.cz)%%00010More information can be found at https://github.com/OmicsWorkflows/KNIME_metanodes
